intro: Callipteris smithiana, commonly known as the coastal maidenhair fern, is a species of fern native to the southeastern United States. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils along the edges of swamps and coastal areas. The plant features delicate, lace-like fronds that are typically green with a slight reddish tint. It is often found in shaded, humid environments, making it a characteristic plant of wetland ecosystems. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important component of its native habitat.
